hero.title: KnowYOU
hero.subtitle: The Evolution of Artificial Intelligence
hero.quote: The exact moment we stopped just operating machines and started, in fact, thinking with them.

software.title: The First Revolution
software.subtitle: Software: The First Human-Machine Communication
software.content: In the 1950s, when the first software programs were developed, a silent revolution began: for the first time in history, humans could give direct instructions to machines through programming languages. This was the first step towards communication between man and machine.

internet.title: The Age of Connectivity
internet.subtitle: Internet: The Global Connection Revolution
internet.content: In the 1990s, the Internet radically transformed how we communicate, work, and access information. What started as a military project became the fundamental infrastructure of modern digital society.

techNoPropose.title: The Technology Hype
techNoPropose.subtitle: Technologies Without Clear Purpose
techNoPropose.content: Between 2020-2022, we witnessed the emergence of technologies like Metaverse and NFTs that, despite massive hype, failed to demonstrate clear purpose or tangible value to society.

kubrick.title: Kubrick's Prophecy
kubrick.subtitle: 1969: Kubrick and the Vision of HAL 9000
kubrick.content: In '2001: A Space Odyssey', Stanley Kubrick envisioned HAL 9000, a computer that not only processed data but conversed naturally with humans, anticipating decades in advance what we experience today with conversational AI.

watson.title: Watson: The Cognition Revolution
watson.subtitle: 2004-2011: The Awakening of Cognitive AI
watson.content: IBM Watson revolutionized the concept of artificial intelligence by defeating human champions on Jeopardy! in 2011. For the first time, a machine demonstrated the ability to understand natural language, process context, and respond accurately to complex questions.

newEra.title: The New Era of AI
newEra.subtitle: Generative AI: Natural Communication and Creativity
newEra.content: Starting in 2022, with the launch of ChatGPT, we entered the era of generative AI, where machines not only respond but converse, create content, and collaborate naturally with humans in various contexts.

digitalExclusion.title: 5.74 billion
digitalExclusion.subtitle: people still cannot access the internet
digitalExclusion.content:
While we celebrate AI advances, it is crucial to recognize that 5.74 billion people still lack internet access. This digital exclusion represents not just a technological gap, but a fundamental barrier to knowledge, opportunities, and participation in modern society.

Beyond physical access, we face linguistic barriers: most AI models are trained predominantly in English, limiting their effectiveness for billions of speakers of other languages. There is also a significant cognitive gap - many people lack basic digital literacy and skills needed to interact effectively with AI systems.

For the AI revolution to be truly inclusive, we must simultaneously address access infrastructure, multilingual model development, and comprehensive digital education programs that empower people from all backgrounds to participate in this new technological era.

goodPrompt.title: The Art of Good Prompting
goodPrompt.subtitle: How to Communicate Effectively with AI
goodPrompt.content: An effective prompt is clear, specific, and contextual. Learn the art of formulating questions and instructions that maximize the quality of AI responses.

turingLegacy.title: Turing's Legacy
turingLegacy.quote: Long before we talked to computers, he dared to ask if they could think. Breaking Enigma won the war, but the 'Imitation Game' won time.
turingLegacy.author: by Fernando Arbache
